parts.text: {"word":"habituarse","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","reflexive":"true","definition":"慣れる、順応する、習慣になる","english_definition":"to get used to, to become accustomed to, to become habituated to","examples":[{"sentence":"Me habitué al clima frío.","translation":"私は寒い気候に慣れた。","english_translation":"I got used to the cold climate."},{"sentence":"Se habituó a la rutina diaria.","translation":"彼は毎日のルーティンに慣れた。","english_translation":"He got used to the daily routine."},{"sentence":"Es difícil habituarse a vivir en una ciudad grande.","translation":"大都市に住むことに慣れるのは難しい。","english_translation":"It's difficult to get used to living in a big city."}],"collocations":["habituarse a algo (～に慣れる)","habituarse a hacer algo (～することに慣れる)"],"synonyms":["acostumbrarse","familiarizarse","adaptarse","acomodarse"],"antonyms":["desacostumbrarse","extrañarse"],"conjugation":{"present":{"yo":"me habitúo","tú":"te habitúas","él/ella/usted":"se habitúa","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituamos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituáis","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habitúan"},"preterite":{"yo":"me habitué","tú":"te habituaste","él/ella/usted":"se habituó","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituamos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituasteis","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habituaron"},"imperfect":{"yo":"me habituaba","tú":"te habituabas","él/ella/usted":"se habituaba","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituábamos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituabais","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habituaban"},"future":{"yo":"me habituaré","tú":"te habituarás","él/ella/usted":"se habituará","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituaremos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituaréis","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habituarán"},"conditional":{"yo":"me habituaría","tú":"te habituarías","él/ella/usted":"se habituaría","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituaríamos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituaríais","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habituarían"},"subjunctive_present":{"yo":"me habitúe","tú":"te habitúes","él/ella/usted":"se habitúe","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituemos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituéis","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habitúen"},"subjunctive_imperfect":{"yo":"me habituara/me habituase","tú":"te habituaras/te habituases","él/ella/usted":"se habituara/se habituase","nosotros/nosotras":"nos habituáramos/nos habituásemos","vosotros/vosotras":"os habituarais/os habituaseis","ellos/ellas/ustedes":"se habituaran/se habituasen"},"imperative":{"tú":"habitúate","usted":"habitúese","nosotros/nosotras":"habituémonos","vosotros/vosotras":"habituaos","ustedes":"habitúense"}}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Habituarse' is a reflexive verb, meaning it requires a reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se) to indicate that the subject is performing the action on themselves. It expresses the process of becoming accustomed to something, whether it's a new environment, a routine, or a habit. It often implies a gradual adjustment over time.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo habitué al clima frío.","correct":"Yo me habitué al clima frío.","note":"The reflexive pronoun 'me' is essential because the subject 'yo' is getting used to the climate."},{"incorrect":"Habituar al ruido.","correct":"Habituarse al ruido.","note":"The infinitive form must also be reflexive: 'habituarse' instead of 'habituar'."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["hábito (habit)","habituación (habituation)","habitual (habitual)"],"phrases":["estar habituado a (to be used to)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"frequency_corpus":"Relatively common in written and spoken Spanish.","priority":"★★☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"'Habituarse' means 'to get used to' something. It's a reflexive verb, so remember to use the correct reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se). It's used to describe the process of becoming comfortable or familiar with a new situation, environment, or routine. For example, 'Me habitué a la comida picante' means 'I got used to spicy food.'"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Después de un tiempo, te habitúas al ruido de la ciudad.","translation":"After a while, you get used to the noise of the city.","english_translation":"After a while, you get used to the noise of the city.","type":"example"},{"sentence":"Nos habituamos a madrugar para ir a trabajar.","translation":"We got used to waking up early to go to work.","english_translation":"We got used to waking up early to go to work.","type":"example"},{"sentence":"Es importante habituarse a las nuevas tecnologías.","translation":"It's important to get used to new technologies.","english_translation":"It's important to get used to new technologies.","type":"example"}]}
